summary: The Servicemembers and Veterans Empowerment and Support Act of 2025 aims to expand healthcare and benefits for veterans, particularly focusing on military sexual trauma (MST). The bill defines MST, mandates reports and studies on MST in the digital age and claims processing, and provides for enhanced communications and support for those who have experienced MST. It also broadens eligibility for MST counseling, improves access to care, and addresses the needs of individuals who attended service academies. The bill amends Title 38 of the United States Code with various provisions to provide compensation for said individuals.
